fields.name: molecular_entity_name
fields.description: the response variable name is meant to hold a human readable label or common name denoting the entity

fields.name: library
fields.description: a screening library is a collection of materials engineered to identify qualities of a subset of its members during a screening process

fields.name: supplier
fields.description: the name of the manufacturer or supplier of the library

fields.name: gene_id
fields.description: an identifier from molecular entity database/ontology

fields.name: database_namespace1
fields.description: a shorthand denoting the resource namespace and used to create compact uris, for instance: 'uniprot' or 'chembl'. Obtain the actual official tag from https://FAIRsharing.org

fields.name: database identifier2
fields.description: an identifier from molecular entity database/ontology

fields.name: database_namespace2
fields.description: a shorthand denoting the resource namespace and used to create compact uris, for instance: 'uniprot' or 'chembl'. Obtain the actual official tag from https://FAIRsharing.org

fields.name: database_identifier3
fields.description: an identifier from molecular entity database/ontology

fields.name: database_namespace3
fields.description: a shorthand denoting the resource namespace and used to create compact uris, for instance: 'uniprot' or 'chembl'. Obtain the actual official tag from https://FAIRsharing.org

fields.name: average
fields.description: the sample mean of sample of size n with n observations is an arithmetic mean computed over n number of observations on a statistical sample.

fields.name: standard_deviation
fields.description: The standard deviation of a random variable, statistical population, data set, or probability distribution is a measure of variation which correspond to the average distance from the mean of the data set to any given point of that dataset.

fields.name: group_size
fields.description: statistical sample size is a count evaluating the number of individual experimental units in a treatment group

fields.name: hit_score
fields.description: hit selection is a planned process which in screening processes such as high-throughput screening, lead to the identification of perturbing agent which cause the typical signal generated by a standardized assay to significantly differ from the negative control

fields.name: timepoint
fields.description: Time point at which a sample or observation is made or taken from a biomaterial as measured from some reference point.
